pageContext.publications: Ten Years’ Diggings (Bateman) pp. 225-6, Catalogue of Bateman Antiquities (S.C.M. 1899) p.  75., Evans (1881) p.  227., Piggott Culture and Environment P83 Fig 18 no 16.
pageContext.collection: Sheffield City Museum, Bateman Collection, J.93. 454
pageContext.site: England, Yorkshire, found in a barrow at Scamridge, 11 mi. E. of Pickering, 1851.
pageContext.toSearch: Low Scamridge Cottage, Ebberston, Scarborough, North Yorkshire Yo13 9pd, UK
pageContext.remarks: Inhumation in cist, overlying tumulus almost totally destroyed by plowing.  The scraper, 2 small stone spheres (1” x 2” diam.), and “peculiarly-shaped stone”, Bateman notes that possibility of recovering handle of dagger (of bone) if more care had been taken during excavation, (T.Y.D.)
